org.sat4j

Interface ILauncherMode

  • All Superinterfaces:
    SolutionFoundListener

    public interface ILauncherMode
extends SolutionFoundListener
    Allow to change the behavior of the launcher (either decision or optimization mode)
    Since:
    2.3.3
    Author:
    sroussel

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String ANSWER_PREFIX 
      static java.lang.String CURRENT_OPTIMUM_VALUE_PREFIX 
      static ILauncherMode DECISION
      The launcher is in decision mode: the answer is either SAT, UNSAT or UNKNOWN
      static ILauncherMode OPTIMIZATION
      The launcher is in optimization mode: the answer is either SAT, UPPER_BOUND, OPTIMUM_FOUND, UNSAT or UNKNOWN.
      static java.lang.String SOLUTION_PREFIX 

      • Fields inherited from interface org.sat4j.tools.SolutionFoundListener

        VOID

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void displayResult(ISolver solver, IProblem problem, ILogAble logger, java.io.PrintWriter out, Reader reader, long beginTime, boolean displaySolutionLine)
      Output of the launcher when the solver stops
      ExitCode getCurrentExitCode()
      Allow the launcher to get the current status of the problem: SAT, UNSAT, UPPER_BOUND, etc.
      void setExitCode(ExitCode exitCode)
      Allow to set a specific exit code to the launcher (in case of trivial unsatisfiability for instance).
      void setIncomplete(boolean isIncomplete)
      Allows the launcher to specifically return an upper bound of the optimal solution in case of a time out (for maxsat competitions for instance).
      void solve(IProblem problem, Reader reader, ILogAble logger, java.io.PrintWriter out, long beginTime)
      Main solver call: one call for a decision problem, a loop for an optimization problem.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.sat4j.tools.SolutionFoundListener

        onSolutionFound, onSolutionFound, onUnsatTermination

    • Field Detail

      • SOLUTION_PREFIX

        static final java.lang.String SOLUTION_PREFIX
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ANSWER_PREFIX

        static final java.lang.String ANSWER_PREFIX
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CURRENT_OPTIMUM_VALUE_PREFIX

        static final java.lang.String CURRENT_OPTIMUM_VALUE_PREFIX
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DECISION

        static final ILauncherMode DECISION
        The launcher is in decision mode: the answer is either SAT, UNSAT or UNKNOWN

      • OPTIMIZATION

        static final ILauncherMode OPTIMIZATION
        The launcher is in optimization mode: the answer is either SAT, UPPER_BOUND, OPTIMUM_FOUND, UNSAT or UNKNOWN. Using the incomplete property, the solver returns an upper bound of the optimal solution when a time out occurs.

    • Method Detail

      • displayResult

        void displayResult(ISolver solver,
                   IProblem problem,
                   ILogAble logger,
                   java.io.PrintWriter out,
                   Reader reader,
                   long beginTime,
                   boolean displaySolutionLine)
        Output of the launcher when the solver stops
        Parameters:
        solver - the solver that is launched by the launcher
        problem - the problem that is solved
        logger - the element that is able to log the result
        out - the printwriter to associate to the solver
        reader - the problem reader
        beginTime - the time at which the solver was launched
        displaySolutionLine - indicates whether the solution line shound be displayed or not (not recommended for large solutions)

      • solve

        void solve(IProblem problem,
           Reader reader,
           ILogAble logger,
           java.io.PrintWriter out,
           long beginTime)
        Main solver call: one call for a decision problem, a loop for an optimization problem.
        Parameters:
        problem - the problem to solve
        reader - the reader that provided the problem object
        logger - the element that is able to log the result
        out - the printwriter to associate to the solver
        beginTime - the time at which the solver starts

      • setIncomplete

        void setIncomplete(boolean isIncomplete)
        Allows the launcher to specifically return an upper bound of the optimal solution in case of a time out (for maxsat competitions for instance).
        Parameters:
        isIncomplete - true if the solver should return the best solution found so far.

      • getCurrentExitCode

        ExitCode getCurrentExitCode()
        Allow the launcher to get the current status of the problem: SAT, UNSAT, UPPER_BOUND, etc.
        Returns:
        the status of the problem.

      • setExitCode

        void setExitCode(ExitCode exitCode)
        Allow to set a specific exit code to the launcher (in case of trivial unsatisfiability for instance).
        Parameters:
        exitCode - the status of the problem to solve
